Detailed Description

The class CrssHandler supports call related supplementary services like Hold(), Retrieve(), Swap(), etc. Furthermore, there are methods for multi-party call support. The methods are active wait dispatcher based, i.e. the methods return upon completion of the whole opertaion. Explicit call transfer is one exception, the disconnect indications for the both calls will arrive asyncronously after the method returns.

Member Function Documentation

CallApiRc CrssHandler::ExplicitCallTransfer (  CallIndex  call_index  ) 
 

Sends an explicit call transfer request to the network. The methos returns upon sucessful ECT request (the disconnect indications for the two calls will follow up) or on failure (network denies the ECT request, or the ECT timer expires.

Parameters:
call_index One of the two calls to be transfered.
Returns:
CallApiRc See CallHdl::ExplicitCallTransfer().

HandlerId CrssHandler::GetHandlerId (   )  const [virtual]
 

SsErrorCode CrssHandler::GetLastErrorCode (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the error code occurred the last time while the active wait dispatcher CrssDispatcher was invoked. A return value of SsErrorCode::NoError indicates that no particular error code has been sent from the protocol stack.

CallApiRc CrssHandler::Hold (  CallIndex  idx  ) 
 

Holds an active call and returns NoError if successful. Starts a StackMsgActiveWaitDispatcher, sends the corresponding request to the protocol stack and evaluates the messages of the protocol stack in the methods of CallDispatcher. Refer to the documentation of Hold() in the class CallHdl.

Parameters:
call_index A reference to the call to be held.
Returns:
Refer to Hold() of class CallHdl.

CallApiRc CrssHandler::JoinCalls (   ) 
 

Creates a multi party call from a held and an active call, or adds an active call to an existing multi party call. .

Returns:
Refer to JoinCalls() of class CallHdl.

CallApiRc CrssHandler::ReleaseActiveCall (   )  const
 

Analogue to ReleaseAllActiveCalls() but releases only one specific active call.Further information is also avaible in the documentation of class CallHdl.

Parameters:
call_index Refers to the call to be released.
Returns:
Refer to ReleaseActiveCall() of class CallHdl.

CallApiRc CrssHandler::ReleaseAllActiveCalls (   )  const
 

Analogue to ReleaseAllHeldCalls() but releases all calls in state active.

Returns:
Refer to ReleaseAllActiveCalls() of class CallHdl.

CallApiRc CrssHandler::ReleaseAllHeldCalls (   )  const
 

Releases all calls (voice and data) which are in state hold. Sends the corresponding request to the protocol stack. The internal data structure is updated immediately. A the disconnection confirmation will be sent by network or the stack itself (after 30sec). One call index is given to the protocol stack as prepresentant for all held calls.

Returns:
CallDataLocked - Refer to Setup(...).

CallApiRc CrssHandler::ReleaseMpty (  UINT32 &  duration,
BOOLEAN  wait_condition = FALSE
)  const
 

Releases all members of an active or held multi party call.

Parameters:
duration Will be set to the call duration value.
wait_condition TRUE for synchronous waiting of release
Returns:
Refer to Release() of class MptyCallHdl.

CallApiRc CrssHandler::Retrieve (  CallIndex  idx  ) 
 

Retrieves a held call and returns NoError if successful. Starts a StackMsgActiveWaitDispatcher, sends the corresponding request to the protocol stack and evaluates the messages of the protocol stack in the methods of CallDispatcher. Refer to the documentation of Retrieve() in the class CallHdl..

Parameters:
call_index The reference to the call to be retrieved.
Returns:
Refer to Retrieve() of class CallHdl.

CallApiRc CrssHandler::SplitMpty (  CallIndex  call_index  ) 
 

Holds the active multi-party call except of the call call_index which remains active.

Parameters:
call_index The call which has to be splitted from the multi- party call. .
Returns:
Refer to JoinCalls() of class CallHdl.

CallApiRc CrssHandler::SwapCalls (   )  const
 

The method SwapCalls() holds the active call, retrieves the held call and returns NoError in case of success. SwapCalls() consecutively calls Hold(CallIndex idx) and Retrieve(CallIndex idx). Refer to this methods for more detailed information.

Returns:
Refer to CallHdl::SwapCalls().
